body:
### Problem

With `extui` enabled and `cmdheight=0`, popup menu appears far above the cmdline.

Notes for the steps below.
- `<C-BSlash>e` (c_CTRL-\_e) is necessary to reproduce it.
- `'ca'` is just an example of an incomplete Ex command to trigger popup menu.

### Steps to reproduce

  `nvim --clean -u NONE -c "lua require('vim._extui').enable({ msg = { target = 'box' } })" -c "set cmdheight=0" -c "set wildcharm=<C-z>" -c "cnoremap <Tab> <C-BSlash>e'ca'<CR><C-z>"`
`:<Tab>`


### Expected behavior

Popup menu should appear just above the cmdline as usual.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.12.0-dev-599+g1deba926c4

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

NixOS 25.05

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.42.1

### $TERM environment variable

tmux-256color

### Installation

repo
title: ` extui` displays pum at invalid position with `cmdheight=0`
